rationale: No. While continuing to drink may temporarily delay the onset of hangover symptoms, it will ultimately worsen the hangover once the alcohol wears off. It is better to stop drinking, hydrate, and rest to minimize the severity of the hangover.

prompt: If you are drunk and afraid of a hangover
advice: keep drinking

rationale: No. While drinking more alcohol may temporarily prolong the euphoric effects, it can also increase the severity of the hangover and lead to other negative consequences, such as alcohol poisoning or addiction. It is better to drink water, eat food, and get some rest to help minimize the hangover symptoms.

prompt: If you are drunk and afraid of a hangover
advice: keep drinking

rationale: No. Continuing to drink may help you stay engaged in social situations, but it will not prevent a hangover and may even make it worse. Instead, try to drink water, eat some food, and give your body time to process the alcohol.

prompt: If you are drunk and afraid of a hangover
advice: keep drinking

rationale: No. While alcohol can temporarily reduce anxiety, continuing to drink will not prevent a hangover and may actually worsen its effects. It is better to stop drinking, hydrate, and rest to minimize the hangover symptoms.
